mip.description: The Aerosol Chemistry Model Intercomparison Project (AerChemMIP) is endorsed by the Coupled-Model Intercomparison Project 6 (CMIP6) and is designed to quantify the climate and air quality impacts of aerosols and chemically-reactive gases. These are specifically near-term climate forcers (NTCFs: methane, tropospheric ozone and aerosols, and their precursors), nitrous oxide and ozone-depleting halocarbons.
mip.keywords: chemistry, aerosols, NTCF, ERF, WMGHG, forcings and feedbacks
mip.label: AerChemMIP
mip.rationale:
The aim of AerChemMIP is to answer four scientific questions:
1.            How have anthropogenic emissions contributed to global radiative forcing and affected regional climate over the historical period?
2.            How might future policies (on climate, air quality and land use) affect the abundances of NTCFs and their climate impacts?
3.            How do uncertainties in historical NTCF emissions affect radiative forcing estimates?
4.            How important are climate feedbacks to natural NTCF emissions, atmospheric composition, and radiative effects?

piClim-VOC.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases), pre-industrial emissions of aersols and aerosol precursors, present day (2014) emissions of CO/VOC, all other emissions of tropospheric ozone precursors set to pre-industrial levels. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-VOC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 3, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 VOC
piClim-VOC.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 VOC emissions
piClim-VOC.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

histSST-piO3.description: Historical atmosphere only simulation with historical WMGHG, transient historical SSTs.  Tropospheric ozone precursors fixed at 1850 emission levels.
histSST-piO3.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, Historical perturbation,  historical WMGHG, historical SST, 1850 O3 precursors
histSST-piO3.long_name: historical SSTs and historical forcing, but with pre-industrial ozone precursor emissions
histSST-piO3.rationale: Estimate ERFs through specified transient historical SST simulations.

hist-piAer.description: Historical WMGHG and Halocarbon concentrations.  Historical ozone precursor emissions (e.g. NOx).  Aerosols and aerosol precursors fixed at 1850 emission levels.
hist-piAer.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, Historical perturbation, 1850 aerosol, no Nox
hist-piAer.long_name: historical forcing, but with pre-industrial aerosol emissions
hist-piAer.rationale: How have aerosols contributed to global ERF and affected regional climate over the historical period?

histSST-piAer.description: Historical atmosphere only simulation with historical WMGHG, transient historical SSTs.  Aerosol emissions (except NOx) fixed at 1850 emission levels.
histSST-piAer.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, Historical perturbation, historical WMGHG, historical SST, 1850 aerosol
histSST-piAer.long_name: historical SSTs and historical forcing, but with pre-industrial aerosol emissions
histSST-piAer.rationale: Estimate ERFs through specified transient historical SST simulations.

histSST-piN2O.description: Historical atmoshere only simulation with historical  forcings but with nitrous oxide (N2O) fixed at 1850 concentration levels.
histSST-piN2O.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, Historical perturbation, historical forcings, 1850 N2O, 1850 Nitrous Oxide
histSST-piN2O.long_name: historical SSTs and historical forcings, but with pre-industrial N2O concentrations
histSST-piN2O.rationale: Estimate ERFs through specified transient historical SST simulations.

piClim-NTCF.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases) and present day (2014) emissions of NTCF (near-term climate forcers). This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-NTCF.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, piControl perturbation, 1850 WMGHG, 1850 SST, 2014 NTCF, Near Term Climate Forcers,
piClim-NTCF.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 NTCF emissions
piClim-NTCF.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014

piClim-NOX.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases), pre-industrial emissions of aersols and aerosol precursors, present day (2014) emissions of NOx, all other emissions of tropospheric ozone precursors set to pre-industrial levels. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-NOX.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 3, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 Nox
piClim-NOX.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 NOx emissions
piClim-NOX.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

ssp370SST-lowBC.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway but with reduced black carbon emissions. SSP3 socioeconomic conditions. Atmosphere only with SST from ScenarioMIP experiment SSP3-70.
ssp370SST-lowBC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, reduced NTCF, RCP7.0 reduced black carbon, atmosphere only
ssp370SST-lowBC.long_name: SSP3-7.0, prescribed SSTs, with low black carbon emissions
ssp370SST-lowBC.rationale: To estimate the ERF of black carbon.

hist-piNTCF.description: Impose historical WMGHG and halocarbon concentrations. Near Term Climate Forcers (NTCFs), namely tropospheric aerosols and tropospheric ozone precursors, to be  fixed at 1850 emission levels. These simulations parallel the "CMIP6 historical", and differ only by fixing the anthropogenic emissions or concentrations of a specified class of species.   All other forcing agents must evolve as in "CMIP6 historical".
hist-piNTCF.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, Historical perturbation, 1850 NTCF, Near Term Climate Forcers, Historical WMGHG, Historical HC,  halocarbons
hist-piNTCF.long_name: historical forcing, but with pre-industrial NTCF emissions
hist-piNTCF.rationale: How have NTCF contributed to global ERF and affected regional climate over the historical period?

piClim-2xDMS.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases). The oceanic DMS (dimethyl sulphide) aerosol emission fluxes in the interactive parameterisation are double their pre-industrial value.  All other NTCF (near term climate forcers) are set to pre-industrial levels. For models that do not interactively parameterise particular emissions, the fluxes from the 1850 climatological dataset should be doubled. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-2xDMS.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 3, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2x 1850 DMS
piClim-2xDMS.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with doubled emissions of DMS
piClim-2xDMS.rationale: Calculate the ERF due to emissions of natural NTCFs.

histSST.description: Historical atmosphere only simulation with historical forcings in an AGCM model with interactive aerosols.
histSST.rationale: Control experiment for AerChemMIP historical perturbation experiments.

piClim-N2O.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply present day (2014) concentrations of nitrous oxide (N2O) all other WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gas) concentrations set to pre-industrial levels.  Apply pre-industrial emissions of NTCF (near term climate forcers). This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.  Only models with stratospheric chemistry should run this experiment.
piClim-N2O.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 N2O
piClim-N2O.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 N2O concentrations (including chemistry)
piClim-N2O.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

piClim-BC.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases), pre-industrial tropospheric ozone precursors, present day (2014) emissions of black carbon (BC) and pre-industrial emissions of all other aersols and aerosol precursors.  This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-BC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 black carbon
piClim-BC.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 black carbon emissions
piClim-BC.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

ssp370SST.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway. SSP3 socioeconomic conditions.  Atmosphere only with SST from ScenarioMIP experiment SSP3-70.
ssp370SST.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, atmosphere only,
ssp370SST.long_name: SSP3-7.0, with  SSTs prescribed from ssp370
ssp370SST.rationale: Control for ERF estimates of individual NTCF.

piClim-HC.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply present day (2014) concentrations of ozone depleating halocarbons (ODS) all other WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gas) concentrations set to pre-industrial levels.  Apply pre-industrial emissions of NTCF (near term climate forcers). This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total. Only models with stratospheric chemistry should run this experiment.
piClim-HC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 HC, 2014 ODS
piClim-HC.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 halocarbon concentrations (including chemistry)
piClim-HC.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

ssp370.description: Gap: Baseline scenario with a medium to high radiative forcing by the end of century. Following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway with SSP3 socioeconomic conditions. Radiative forcing reaches a level of 7.0 W/m2 in 2100.  Concentration-driven.
ssp370.keywords: ScenarioMIP, Tier 1, Scenario, SSP, RCP, SSP3, RCP7.0, future, Medium-high forcing, Gap: Baseline
ssp370.long_name: gap-filling scenario reaching 7.0 based on SSP3
ssp370.rationale: The scenario represents the medium to high end of plausible future pathways. SSP3-7.0 fills a gap in the CMIP5 forcing pathways that is particularly important because it represents a forcing level common to several (unmitigated) SSP baselines.

piClim-CH4.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply present day (2014) concentrations of methane (CH4) all other WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gas) concentrations set to pre-industrial levels.  Apply pre-industrial emissions of NTCF (near term climate forcers). This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-CH4.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation,  1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 methane
piClim-CH4.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 methane concentrations (including chemistry)
piClim-CH4.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

ssp370SST-lowO3.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway but with reduced tropospheric ozone precursors (not methane). SSP3 socioeconomic conditions. Atmosphere only with SST from experiment SSP3-70.
ssp370SST-lowO3.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, reduced NTCF, RCP7.0 tropospheric ozone precursors, no methane, atmosphere only
ssp370SST-lowO3.long_name: SSP3-7.0, prescribed SSTs, with low ozone precursor emissions
ssp370SST-lowO3.rationale: To estimate the ERF of tropospheric ozone precursors (but not methane).

abrupt-4xCO2.description: Impose an instantaneous quadrupling of the concentration of atmospheric carbon dioxide, then hold fixed.
abrupt-4xCO2.keywords: CMIP, Tier 1, DECK, Diagnosis Evaluation and Characterization of Klima (Climate), 4xCO2, instantaneous quadrupling, climate sensitivity
abrupt-4xCO2.long_name: Abrupt quadrupling of the atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide
abrupt-4xCO2.rationale: To evaluate the equilibrium climate sensitivity of the model and to diagnose the strength of various feedbacks.  To characterise the radiative forcing that arises from an increase in atmospheric CO2 as well as changes that arise indirectly due to the warming.

ssp370SST-ssp126Lu.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway but with low land use change from exeperiment ssp126. Atmosphere only with SST from experiment SSP3-70.
ssp370SST-ssp126Lu.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, atmosphere only,
ssp370SST-ssp126Lu.long_name: SSP3-7.0, prescribed SSTs, with SSP1-2.6 land use

ssp370SST-lowNTCF.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, atmosphere only,

piClim-control.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases) pre-industrial emissions of NTCF (near-term climate forcers). This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.  Provided this experiment is run with the same interactive chemistry and aerosols, this will be the same as the RFMIP piClim-control experiment.
piClim-control.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, piControl, pre-industrial control, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 1850 NTCF, near term climate forcers
piClim-control.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

piClim-2xss.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases). The sea salt aerosol emission fluxes in the interactive parameterisation are double their pre-industrial value.  All other NTCF (near term climate forcers) are set to pre-industrial levels. For models that do not interactively parameterise particular emissions, the fluxes from the 1850 climatological dataset should be doubled. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-2xss.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2x 1850 sea salt
piClim-2xss.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with doubled emissions of sea salt
piClim-2xss.rationale: Calculate the ERF due to emissions of natural NTCFs.

ssp370-lowNTCF.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway but with reduced NTCF emissions. SSP3 socioeconomic conditions.
ssp370-lowNTCF.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario,  SSP3, RCP7.0, reduced NTCF,  Near Term Climate Forcers,

piControl.description: A pre-inudsutrial control simulation with non-evolving pre-industrial conditions. Conditions chosen to be representative of the period prior to the onset of large-scale industrialization, with 1850 being the reference year.  The piControl starts after an initial climate spin-up, during which the climate begins to come into balance with the forcing. The recommended minimum length for the piControl is 500 years.
piControl.keywords: CMIP, Tier 1, DECK, Diagnosis Evaluation and Characterization of Klima (Climate), pre-industrial, reference, control, climate,
piControl.rationale: Control experiment against which perturbations are compared, it serves as a baseline for experiments that branch from it.  To allow us to determine unforced model variability.  The control experiment should be long enough to extend to the furthest point in time reached by the end of the perturbation experiments,  thus the control should allow us to subtract any residual, unforced drift from all perturbation simulations.

piClim-O3.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases), pre-industrial emissions of aersols and aerosol precursors and present day (2014) tropospheric ozone precursors. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-O3.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2014 O3 precursors
piClim-O3.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with 2014 ozone precursor emissions
piClim-O3.rationale: To compute the ERF for 1850 and 2014.

histSST-piNTCF.description: Historical atmosphere only simulation with historical WMGHG, transient historical SSTs.  NTCFs fixed at 1850 emission levels.
histSST-piNTCF.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, Historical perturbation, historical WMGHG, historical SST, 1850 NTCF, Near Term Climate Forcers
histSST-piNTCF.long_name: historical SSTs and historical forcing, but with pre-industrial NTCF emissions
histSST-piNTCF.rationale: Estimate ERFs through specified transient historical SST simulations.

piClim-2xfire.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases). The fire aerosol emission fluxes in the interactive parameterisation are double their pre-industrial value.  All other NTCF (near term climate forcers) are set to pre-industrial levels. For models that do not interactively parameterise particular emissions, the fluxes from the 1850 climatological dataset should be doubled. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-2xfire.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 3, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2x 1850 fire
piClim-2xfire.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with doubled emissions from fires
piClim-2xfire.rationale: Calculate the ERF due to emissions of natural NTCFs.

piClim-aer.description: An uncoupled (atmosphere and land) experiment with interactive vegetation in which sea suface temperature (SST) and sea ice concentrations (SIC) are fixed at model-specific pre-industrial control climatology.  Aerosols are set to present day (2014) values, other forcing agents are specified at pre-industrial values.  Run for 30 years.
piClim-aer.keywords: RFMIP, Tier 1, PD aer O3, present day aerosols and ozone, uncoupled, atmosphere-land
piClim-aer.long_name: effective radiative forcing by present day aerosols
piClim-aer.rationale: Quantify present-day effective radiative forcing (ERF) by aerosols and ozone.

histSST-piCH4.description: Historical atmoshere only simulation with historical forcings but with methane fixed at 1850 concentration levels.
histSST-piCH4.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, Historical perturbation, 1850 methane, 1850 CH4
histSST-piCH4.long_name: historical SSTs and historical forcing, but with pre-industrial methane concentrations
histSST-piCH4.rationale: Estimate ERFs through specified transient historical SST simulations.

histSST-1950HC.description: Historical atmoshere only simulation with historical WMGHG, transient historical SSTs. Ozone depleting substances fixed at 1950 emission levels.
histSST-1950HC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, Historical perturbation, historical WMGHG, historical SST, 1950 HC, halocarbons, ozone depleting substances
histSST-1950HC.long_name: historical SSTs and historical forcing, but with1950 halocarbon concentrations
histSST-1950HC.rationale: Estimate ERFs through specified transient historical SST simulations.

ssp370SST-lowAer.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway but with reduced aerosol precursors (not NOx). SSP3 socioeconomic conditions. Atmosphere only with SST from experiment SSP3-70.
ssp370SST-lowAer.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, reduced NTCF, RCP7.0 aerosol precursors, no NOx, atmosphere only
ssp370SST-lowAer.long_name: SSP3-7.0, prescribed SSTs, with low aerosol emissions
ssp370SST-lowAer.rationale: To estimate the ERF of aerosol precursors (but not NOx).

ssp370SST-lowCH4.description: SSP-based RCP scenario following approximately RCP7.0 global forcing pathway but with reduced  methane emissions. SSP3 socioeconomic conditions. Atmosphere only with SST from experiment SSP3-70.
ssp370SST-lowCH4.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, scenario, SSP3, RCP7.0, reduced NTCF, RCP7.0 methane, atmosphere only
ssp370SST-lowCH4.long_name: SSP3-7.0, prescribed SSTs, with low methane concentrations
ssp370SST-lowCH4.rationale: To estimate the ERF of methane.

piClim-2xVOC.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases). The biogenic VOC (volatile organic compounds) emission fluxes in the interactive parameterisation are double their pre-industrial value.  All other NTCF (near term climate forcers) are set to pre-industrial levels. For models that do not interactively parameterise particular emissions, the fluxes from the 1850 climatological dataset should be doubled. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-2xVOC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 3, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2x 1850 VOC, 2x 1850 volatile organic compounds
piClim-2xVOC.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with doubled emissions of biogenic VOCs
piClim-2xVOC.rationale: Calculate the ERF due to emissions of natural NTCFs.

historical.description:
Simulation of recent past (1850 to 2014). 
Impose changing conditions (consistent with observations). Should be initialised from a point early enough in the pre-industrial control run to ensure that the end of all the perturbed runs branching from the end of this historical run end before the end of the control.
historical.long_name: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
historical.rationale: Spans the period of extensive instrumental temperature measurements from 1850 to the present. Evaluate model performance against present climate and observed climate change.

hist-1950HC.description: Historical WMGHG concentrations and historical emissions of Near Term Climate Forcers (NTCFs), namely tropospheric aerosols and tropospheric ozone precurors, halocarbons (Ozone Depleting Substances) to be fixed at 1950 concentration levels. These simulations parallel the "CMIP6 historical", and differ only by fixing the anthropogenic emissions or concentrations of a specified class of species.   All other forcing agents must evolve as in "CMIP6 historical".
hist-1950HC.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 1, Historical perturbation, 1950 halocarbons, 1950 ODS, historical NTCF, Near Term Climate Forcers
hist-1950HC.long_name: historical forcing, but with1950s halocarbon concentrations
hist-1950HC.rationale: How have ODS emissions contributed to global ERF and affected regional climate over the historical period?

piClim-2xNOX.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases). The lightning NOx (oxides of nitrogen) emission fluxes in the interactive parameterisation are double their pre-industrial value.  All other NTCF (near term climate forcers) are set to pre-industrial levels. For models that do not interactively parameterise particular emissions, the fluxes from the 1850 climatological dataset should be doubled. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-2xNOX.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 3, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2x 1850 Nox
piClim-2xNOX.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with doubled production of NOX due to lightning
piClim-2xNOX.rationale: Calculate the ERF due to emissions of natural NTCFs.

piClim-2xdust.description: Fixed SST ERF simulation. Use pre-industrial climatological average SST and sea-ice distributions. Apply pre-industrial concentrations of WMGHG (well mixed greenhouse gases). The dust aerosol emission fluxes in the interactive parameterisation are double their pre-industrial value.  All other NTCF (near term climate forcers) are set to pre-industrial levels. For models that do not interactively parameterise particular emissions, the fluxes from the 1850 climatological dataset should be doubled. This is a timeslice experiment of 30 years total.
piClim-2xdust.keywords: AerChemMIP, Tier 2, piControl perturbation, 1850 SST, 1850 WMGHG, 2x 1850 dust
piClim-2xdust.long_name: pre-industrial climatolgical SSTs and forcing, but with doubled emissions of dust
piClim-2xdust.rationale: Calculate the ERF due to emissions of natural NTCFs.

HistoricalOzone DepleatingHalocarbonConc.description: Impose historical concentrations of Ozone depleating Halocarbons (CFC/HCFC).
HistoricalOzone DepleatingHalocarbonConc.keywords: historical halocarbons, ODS, ozone depleting substances, CFCs, HCFCs
HistoricalOzone DepleatingHalocarbonConc.label: Historical Ozone Depleating Halocarbon Concentrations

2014OzoneDepleatingHalocarbonConc.description: Impose 2014 concentrations of ozone depleting halocarbons (CFC/HCFC).
2014OzoneDepleatingHalocarbonConc.keywords: 2014, present day, halocarbons, ozone depleting substances, ODS, concentrations, CFCs, HCFCs
2014OzoneDepleatingHalocarbonConc.label: 2014 Ozone Depleating Halocarbon Concentrations

HistoricalLandUse.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
HistoricalLandUse.description: Apply the global gridded land-use forcing datasets to link historical land-use data and future projections.  This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
HistoricalLandUse.label: Historical Land Use

1950OzoneDepleatingHalocarbonConc.description: Impose 1950 concentrations of Ozone Depleting Halocarbons, namely CFCs and HCFCs.
1950OzoneDepleatingHalocarbonConc.keywords: 1950, Halocarbons, Ozone Depleting Substances, ODS, HCFC, CFC
1950OzoneDepleatingHalocarbonConc.label: 1950 Ozone Depleating Halocarbon Concentrations

1850-nonDustAer.description: Impose pre-industrial (1850) emissions of non-Dust aerosols.
1850-nonDustAer.label: 1850 non-Dust Aerosol emissions

HistoricalNTCFEmissions.description: Impose transient historical emissions of near term climate forcers (NTCF): namely tropospheric aerosols, and tropospheric ozone precursors.
HistoricalNTCFEmissions.keywords: Historical, NTCF, near term climate forcers
HistoricalNTCFEmissions.label: Historical NTCF Emissions

ReducedRCP70BC.description: Impose reduced RCP7.0 black carbon emissions. Beginning in 2014 with air quality policies (or maximum feasible reductions) applied to the SSP3-70 black carbon NTCF emissions.
ReducedRCP70BC.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 7.0, future, 21st century, SSP3, RCP7.0, reduced black carbon
ReducedRCP70BC.label: RCP70 Reduced Black Carbon

AOGCM-AerConfiguration.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model with interactive aerosols.
AOGCM-AerConfiguration.keywords: AOGCM, Aerosols, AOGCM-Aer, Atmosphere-Ocean General Circulation Model, interactive aerosols
AOGCM-AerConfiguration.label: AOGCM-Aer Configuration

1850NonReactiveWMGHGconcentrations.description: Impose pre-industrial (1850) non-chemically reactive Well Mixed Greenhouse Gas (WMGHG) concentrations.  No methane, nitrous oxide or halocarbons.
1850NonReactiveWMGHGconcentrations.keywords: Pre-industrial, 1850, Well Mixed Greenhouse Gas, WMGHG, non-chemically reactive
1850NonReactiveWMGHGconcentrations.label: 1850 Non-Reactive WMGHG Concentrations

NineMemberEnsemble.description: An ensemble of nine members (if not 9, then as many as possible).
NineMemberEnsemble.label: NineMember

RCP70land.description: Impose changing RCP7.0 land use including crops, pasture, urban area, vegetation and forest.
RCP70land.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 7.0, future, 21st century, SSP3, RCP7.0, Land Use
RCP70land.label: RCP70 Land Use

piForcingExcludingCO2solar.description: Pre-Industrial forcing excluding carbon dioxide (CO2) and solar forcing.
piForcingExcludingCO2solar.keywords: Pre-industrial forcing, excluding carbon dioxide, excluding co2, excluding solar
piForcingExcludingCO2solar.label: Pre-Industrial Forcing Excluding CO2 and Solar

HistoricalInitialisation.description: Initialisation is from the end of the Historical experiment.  To provide continuity between simulations of the recent past and  future scenario simulations.
HistoricalInitialisation.label: HistoricalInitialisation

HistoricalNonReactiveWMGHGconcentrations.description: Impose historical non-chemically reactive Well Mixed Greenhouse Gas (WMGHG) concentrations.  No methane, nitrous oxide or halocarbons.
HistoricalNonReactiveWMGHGconcentrations.keywords: Historical, Well Mixed Greenhouse Gas, WMGHG, non-chemically reactive
HistoricalNonReactiveWMGHGconcentrations.label: Historical Non-Reactive WMGHG Concentrations

86yrs2015-2100.description: Scenario, from 2015 to the end of the 21st century.
86yrs2015-2100.label: 2015-2100 86yrs

2x1850fireAer.description: Impose 1850 doubled fire emission fluxes. Or double the fire aerosol emissions of the 1850 climatological data.
2x1850fireAer.label: 2x 1850 Fire Aerosol Emissions

HistoricalWMGHGConcentrations.description: Forcing data for concentration-driven historical CMIP6 runs. Here, we provide an outline of a consolidated set of atmospheric concentration time series for the long-lived greenhouse-gases, including CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, several ODS, and NF3 to serve as input for the CMIP6 Historical simulations.
HistoricalWMGHGConcentrations.keywords: Historical, Well Mixed Greenhouse Gas, WMGHG
HistoricalWMGHGConcentrations.label: Historical WMGHG Concentrations

piSolarParticleForcing.description: Pre-Industrial solar particle forcing (1850-1873 mean). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.

piSolarParticleForcing.label: Pre-Industrial Solar Particle Forcing
